title: Poster, Boston, A New National Park, 1975
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
signed: In black marker upper right corner: Paul Rand '75
inscribed:
Imprinted in black below title in three columns: Boston National Historical Park: Faneuil Hall / Paul Revere House / Old North Church. Old South Meeting House / Old State House / Bunker HIll / Charlestown Navy Yard. National Park Service / U.S. Department of the Interior.
Imprinted in black lower center: For sale by the Superintendent of Documents U.S. Government Printing Office, Washington, D.C. 20402 Stock No. 024-005-00616-8 [star] GPO 1975-211-318/4
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description: On a blue ground, a white,  five pronged stylized figure resembling an astrix with a small torch fills the upper portion of the sheet. Blue and red squares are scattered over the figure. At lower right center in large black letters: Boston. At lower left center in white: a new national park... . Three short columns of text specifing historic places in the Boston area are listed below.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, Boston, A New National Park, 1975. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-241
